description: 2-hour written exam with short answer questions and objective items covering clinical immunology concepts. Assesses understanding of immunological investigations, diagnostic tools, and treatment advances.
Multiple choice quizzes across weeks 2, 4, 7 and 9 testing lecture content and pre-reading materials. Includes feedback sessions for poorly performing students.
Written exam focusing on practical content from laboratory classes (Weeks 3, 5, 8). Features case studies requiring analysis of clinical scenarios and diagnostic procedures.

Group project involving written research proposal (2000 words) and oral presentation. Includes peer assessment (5%), academic marking of report (10%) and presentation (5%). Focuses on cutting-edge immunology topics.
